720441f-a.title: Manhattan: Haven Avenue - 173rd Street (West)
720441f-a.text:
J. Hood Wright Park: Two views of a frame structure that
was razed in October 1933. This was at the south-westerly
corner and the photographer is viewing same from Haven Avenue
(left) aod W. 173rd Street (right) View No. 2 is in a westerly
direction to show the easterly aide of same and beyond the new
George Washington Bridge.
1932
Views 1 and 2
J. Clargnce Davies Collection, Museum of the Citv of New York
Neg. o's 467 \& 468
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE.

720346f-a.title: Manhattan: Haven Avenue - 173rd Street
720346f-a.text:
(1)
Haven Avenue, east side, from 173r0 to 17tth Streets. The house
in the foreground is the old farmhouse of A. F. Smtth, who had
a six and one-half acre farm here. The main body of the house
probably does not antedate 1870, although it was peceded by
an earlier structure on the same site. The little brick
wing on the south was added between 1902 and 1910.
The little house farther along on the avenue is tho modernized
house standing on the old Howland farm, which adjoined the
Smith farm on the north. The apartment houses beyond, on the
S.E. corner of 176th Street, wene built around 1924.
Around 1910, Haven Avenue used to be known as Buena Vista Avenue.
May 27, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, more than seven years later. The two old houses have
been demolished; and the land is being cleared and made over
into a pak to be called J. Hood Wright Park.
October 30, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720347f-a.title: Manhattan: Haven Avenue - 173rd Street (West)
720347f-a.text:
Haven Ave., west side, north from Wost 173rd Street.
October 30, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
